message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the construction of codes for correcting erasures over directed graphs, which is a problem in information theory (cs.IT). The use of graphs and the consideration of node failures suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the area of graph theory and algorithms (cs.DS). The storage systems and failure models discussed in the paper are also relevant to the field of networked systems and communication (cs.NI). The construction of optimal codes over smaller fields may involve computational complexity and optimization techniques, which are relevant to the area of scientific computing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the area of coding theory (cs.CC) due to its focus on the construction of codes for correcting erasures.
